Posts.Content: Thanks so for to all who have so kindly offered insight. Your responses have given me a great level of comfort. For me the more stories I hear with positive news (especially ones with similar numbers) the more encouraged I am. I am seeing URO on Monday to remove the constant reminder and hopefully he will share his insight.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed on 7/2/217 RALP 8/21/2017 Post op information Gleason Score 7 (98% pattern 3, 2% pattern 4) Tertiary Pattern not applicable Tumor 10% Extraprostatic Extension: Not involved Seminal Vesicle Invasion : Not Identified Margins: Involved by carcinoma Length of positive margin: 2 mm Location of margin: left mid Gleason pattern at margin: 3 Lympovascular Invasion: Not identified Primary tumor: pT2c PSA Nov 2/2017 0.00 Jan 4, 2018 0.00 March 19, 2018 <0.14 (lowest test reading)June2018 0.00, Oct. 2018 0.00, Jan 2019 0.00
Posts.Title: post op pathology report

Posts.Content: I come seeking opinions on my post op pathology report. I'm sorry I don't know how to put it in my signature. Gleason Score 7 (98% pattern 3, 2% pattern 4) Tertiary Pattern not applicable Tumor 10% Extraprostatic Extension: Not involved Seminal Vesicle Invasion : Not Identified Margins: Involved by carcinoma Length of positive margin: 2 mm Location of margin: left mid Gleason pattern at margin: 3 Lympovascular Invasion: Not identified Primary tumor: pT2c so it seems I have good news except for the positive margin. How concerned should I be about the margin? Thanks for any input
